p: The FRAP assay data are summarized in Table 1. All extracts indicated high capacity to scavenge free radicals varying between 388 and 3093 μmol ascorbic acid/g extract and 419–3217 μmol Trolox/g extract. Contrary to DPPH • assay results, but similar to TCP/TFP, the FRAP assay showed SFM to possess the greatest antiradical activity and SFD to be the weakest antioxidant.
